attributes.action: Replace MP (Member of Parliament) with PPS (Parliamentary Public Servant)
attributes.additional_details:
The title currently given to Members of Parliament does NOT in fact correctly convey the job and purpose for which members are elected, i.e to serve the people that elect them.

It seems as soon as they walk across the floor of the house the members forget this basic purpose and somehow become elevated to an 'elite' members' club instead where the only thing that matters is scoring points rather than serving the public.

Please support my suggestion to change the title to PPS so that members never forget their real status and that is to be PUBLIC SERVANTS to the very end.
